Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different habitats on land and in water, such as a forest, garden, and pond.
The student can illustrate various plants in each habitat, such as trees, flowers, and grasses.
The student can draw different animals in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, fish, and ants.
The student can show how living things are different in each habitat by comparing their drawings.
The student can use the drawings to highlight patterns, such as where certain plants and animals are commonly found.
